import pyspark.sql.functions as F
from enum import Enum
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

class HUBType(Enum):
    SQL = "SQL"
    VM = "VM"

class HUBCategory(Enum):
    RI_HUB = "RI enabled - HUB enabled"
    RI_nHUB = "RI enabled - HUB disabled"
    nRI_HUB = "RI disabled - HUB enabled"
    nRI_nHUB = "RI disabled - HUB disabled"
    Unknown = "Unknown"

class DBTypes(Enum):
    DB = "SQL DB"
    MI = "SQL MI"
    VM = "SQL VM"
    Unknown = "Unknown"

class LicenseTypes(Enum):
    Standard = "Standard License"
    Enterprise = "Enterprise License"
    Unknown = "Unknown"

vm_df = cost_df.alias('vm_df')
vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('IsHUB', F.when(F.col('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit') == 'Enabled', True).otherwise(False))
vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('Date', F.date_trunc('month', 'Date'))

# Unit of measure should only have units on format x hours
# vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('UnitHours', F.split('UnitOfMeasure', ' ')[0])

# Compute quantity in hours based on unit of measure
# vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('ServiceHours', F.col('UnitHours') * F.col('Quantity'))

vm_df = vm_df.where(F.col('VCPUs') != 0)
vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('HUBCategory',
    F.when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'RI Usage') & (F.col('IsHUB') == True), HUBCategory.RI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines Licenses') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('Windows Server%')), HUBCategory.RI_nHUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('IsHUB') == True), HUBCategory.nRI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('IsHUB') == False), HUBCategory.nRI_nHUB.value)
    .otherwise(HUBCategory.Unknown.value)

vm_df = vm_df.withColumn('PricesheetService', F.concat(
    F.lit('Windows Server'),
    F.when(F.col('MeterSubCategory') == 'Windows Server Burst', ' Burst - ').otherwise(' - '), 
    F.col('VCPUs'), 
    F.lit(' vCPU VM License')

sql_df = cost_df.alias('sql_df')
sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('IsHUB', F.when((F.col('ai_AHB').isNull()) | (F.col('ai_AHB') == False), False).otherwise(True))
sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('Date', F.date_trunc('month', 'Date'))

sql_df = sql_df.where(
    ((F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/servers%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))) | # SQL DB - RI - HUB
    ((F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances%')) & (F.col('MeterCategory').like('SQL%'))) | # SQL MI - RI - HUB
    ((F.col('MeterCategory') == 'Virtual Machines Licenses') & (F.col('MeterSubCategory').like('SQL Server%'))) # SQL VM ---> HUB disabled (RI?)
)

sql_df = sql_df.where(F.col('MeterSubCategory') != 'SQL Server Express Edition')

# Filter out cost with unit of measure on format x GB/Month or x/Day as these costs are storage/DTUs
sql_df = sql_df.where((~F.col('UnitOfMeasure').like('%GB%')) & (~F.col('UnitOfMeasure').like('%/Day%')))

# Unit of measure should only have units on format x hours
# sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('UnitHours', F.split('UnitOfMeasure', ' ')[0])

# Compute quantity in hours based on unit of measure
# sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('ServiceHours', F.col('UnitHours') * F.col('Quantity'))

sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('DBType', 
    F.when(F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/servers%'), DBTypes.DB.value)
    .when(F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances%'), DBTypes.MI.value)
    .when(F.col('ResourceId').like('%Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines%'), DBTypes.VM.value)
    .otherwise(DBTypes.Unknown.value)
)

sql_df = sql_df.where(F.col('DBType') != DBTypes.Unknown.value)

sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('LicenseType',
    F.when(F.col('Productname').like('%Standard%') | F.col('Productname').like('%General%'), LicenseTypes.Standard.value)
    .when(F.col('Productname').like('%Enterprise%') | F.col('Productname').like('%Critical%'), LicenseTypes.Enterprise.value)
    .otherwise(LicenseTypes.Unknown.value)
)

sql_df = sql_df.where(F.col('LicenseType') != LicenseTypes.Unknown.value)

sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('HUBCategory',
    F.when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'RI Usage') & (F.col('IsHUB') == True), HUBCategory.RI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'RI Usage') & (F.col('IsHUB') == False), HUBCategory.RI_nHUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('IsHUB') == True), HUBCategory.nRI_HUB.value)
    .when((F.col('IsRIUsage') == 'On Demand Usage') == (F.col('IsHUB') == False), HUBCategory.nRI_nHUB.value)
    .otherwise(HUBCategory.Unknown.value)

sql_df = sql_df.withColumn('PricesheetService',
    F.when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.MI.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Standard.value), 'SQL Managed Instance General Purpose - SQL License - vCore')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.MI.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Enterprise.value), 'SQL Managed Instance Business Critical - SQL License - vCore')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.DB.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Standard.value), 'SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - SQL License - vCore')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.DB.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Enterprise.value), 'SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool Business Critical - SQL License - vCore')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.VM.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Standard.value) & (F.col('VCPUs') < 5), 'SQL Server Standard - 1-4 vCPU VM License')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.VM.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Enterprise.value) & (F.col('VCPUs') < 5), 'SQL Server Enterprise - 1-4 vCPU VM License')
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.VM.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Standard.value) & (F.col('VCPUs') >= 5), F.concat(F.lit('SQL Server Standard - '), F.col('VCPUs'), F.lit(' vCPU VM License')))
    .when((F.col('DBType') == DBTypes.VM.value) & (F.col('LicenseType') == LicenseTypes.Enterprise.value) & (F.col('VCPUs') >= 5), F.concat(F.lit('SQL Server Enterprise - '), F.col('VCPUs'), F.lit(' vCPU VM License')))
    .otherwise('undefined')
# Create dummy date column for pricesheet join operation

old_pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/pricesheet-2022*.parquet'
old_pricesheet_df = spark.read.format('parquet').load(old_pricesheet_path)
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.where(F.col('offerId') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumnRenamed('meterName', 'ProductMapping')
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumnRenamed('unitOfMeasure', 'UnitOfMeasure')
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumnRenamed('unitPrice', 'UnitPrice')
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumnRenamed('billingPeriodId', 'BillingPeriodId')
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumn('UnitQuantity', F.split('UnitOfMeasure', ' ')[0])
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.withColumn('PricePerUnit', F.col('UnitPrice') / F.col('UnitQuantity'))
old_pricesheet_df = old_pricesheet_df.select('ProductMapping', 'UnitOfMeasure', 'UnitQuantity', 'UnitPrice', 'PricePerUnit', 'BillingPeriodId')

new_pricesheet_path = f'abfss://usage@{storageAccount}.dfs.core.windows.net/pricesheet/portal-export/FinOps-Pricesheet-Monthly/*/*/*.csv'
new_pricesheet_df = spark.read.csv(new_pricesheet_path, header=True, inferSchema=True)
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.where(F.col('OfferId') == PROD_OFFER_ID)
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.withColumn('FormattedDate', F.to_date(new_pricesheet_df.EffectiveStartDate, 'MM/dd/yyy HH:mm:ss'))
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.withColumn('BillingPeriodId', F.date_format('FormattedDate', "yyyyMM"))
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.withColumn('UnitQuantity', F.split('UnitOfMeasure', ' ')[0])
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.withColumn('PricePerUnit', F.col('UnitPrice') / F.col('UnitQuantity'))
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.withColumnRenamed('Product', 'ProductMapping')
new_pricesheet_df = new_pricesheet_df.select('ProductMapping', 'UnitOfMeasure', 'UnitQuantity', 'UnitPrice', 'PricePerUnit', 'BillingPeriodId')

hub_df = hub_df.join(pricesheet_df, (pricesheet_df.ProductMapping == hub_df.PricesheetService) & (pricesheet_df.BillingPeriodId == hub_df.TempDate), "left")
hub_df = hub_df.drop('PriceSheetService', 'TempDate')

hub_df = hub_df.withColumn('PAYGLicenseCost', F.col('Quantity') * F.col('PricePerUnit'))

hub_df = hub_df.withColumn('CostWithHub', 
    F.when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.nRI_HUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.RI_HUB.value), F.col('ResourceCost'))
    .when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.nRI_nHUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.RI_nHUB.value), F.col('ResourceCost') - F.col('PAYGLicenseCost'))
    .otherwise(None)
)

hub_df = hub_df.withColumn('UnlockedSavings', F.when((F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.RI_HUB.value) | (F.col('HUBCategory') == HUBCategory.nRI_HUB.value), F.col('PAYGLicenseCost')).otherwise(0))
hub_df = hub_df.withColumn('PotentialSavings', F.col('ResourceCost') - F.col('CostWithHub'))

## Finding SQL Server related cost

SQL cost are grouped into three categories:

1. SQL Virtual Machine - Cost with _MeterCategory_ like **Virtual Machines Licenses** and _MeterSubCategory_ like **SQL Server%** (besides SQL Server Express)
2. SQL Managed Instance - Cost with _ResourceId_ like **Microsoft.Sql/managedInstances**
3. SQL Database - Cost with _ResourceId_ like **Microsoft.Sql/servers**


### SQL Database

This category will include _MeterCategories_ like SQL Managed Instance, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, SQL Database and Azure Synapse Analytics.

Should exclude _Microsoft Defender for Cloud_ and _Azure Synapse Analytics_ as these meter categories is not applicable for HUB

### SQL Managed Instance

This category will include _MeterCategories_ like SQL Managed Instance and Microsoft Defender for Cloud.

Should exclude _Microsoft Defender for Cloud_ as this meter category is not applicable for HUB


## SQL Cost with VCPU

There is a lot of cost associated with SQL that has VCPUs set to 0. 
If the unit of measure for these cost items is inspected, it varies between _x hours_, _x / day_ and _x GB/month_
We would only be interested in cost with unit of measure equal to _x hours_ (corresponds to SQL serverless pools), whereas the other corresponds to memory/DTU cost.
